Package com.example.cmput301w24t33.notifications

Class NotificationManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.cmput301w24t33.notifications.NotificationManager
public class NotificationManager extends Object
Manages notifications across the app

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public static void initialize(android.app.Application application)
      Initializes the singleton instance of NotificationManager with the provided application context. This method should be called once, typically in your Application class.
      Parameters:
      application - The application context used for initializing NotificationManager.

    • getInstance

      public static NotificationManager getInstance()
      Retrieves the singleton instance of NotificationManager. If the instance has not been initialized yet, this method throws an IllegalStateException.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of NotificationManager.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if NotificationManager has not been initialized prior to calling getInstance().

    • trackMultipleEventsNotifications

      public void trackMultipleEventsNotifications(Set<String> eventIds)
      Begins tracking notifications for multiple events. Listeners are added to each event ID provided, which will trigger updates upon changes.
      Parameters:
      eventIds - A set of event IDs to track for notifications.

    • trackEventNotification

      public void trackEventNotification(String eventId)
      Starts tracking notifications for a single event. A listener is added to the specified event ID to monitor for notification updates.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to track.

    • stopTrackingEventNotification

      public void stopTrackingEventNotification(String eventId)
      Stops tracking notifications for a specific event. The listener for the given event ID is removed to cease receiving updates.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to stop tracking.

    • addNotification

      public void addNotification(String eventId, Notification notification, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnCompleteListener<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference> onCompleteListener)
      Adds a new notification to the specified event and invokes the onCompleteListener upon completion.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to which the notification should be added.
      notification - The notification object to add.
      onCompleteListener - The listener to be called upon completion of the add operation.

    • deleteNotification

      public void deleteNotification(String eventId, String notificationId, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnCompleteListener<Void> onCompleteListener)
      Deletes a notification from the specified event and invokes the onCompleteListener upon completion.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event from which the notification should be deleted.
      notificationId - The ID of the notification to delete.
      onCompleteListener - The listener to be called upon completion of the delete operation.

    • fetchNotificationsForEvent

      public void fetchNotificationsForEvent(String eventId, NotificationRepository.NotificationsFetchListener listener)
      Fetches notifications for a specific event and invokes the provided listener with the results.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event for which to fetch notifications.
      listener - The listener to be invoked with the fetched notifications.

    • trackAttendeeUpdatesForEvent

      public void trackAttendeeUpdatesForEvent(String eventId)
      Initiates monitoring of attendee count updates for an event. This sets up a listener that will trigger a callback method when attendee data changes.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to monitor for attendee count updates.

    • updateEventMilestone

      public void updateEventMilestone(String eventId, String milestoneKey, boolean value)
      Updates the milestone status for a given event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event for which the milestone status is to be updated.
      milestoneKey - The key of the milestone to update (e.g., "half" or "full").
      value - The new value for the milestone (true or false).
